thread.title: Only 3 teams have clearer path to 12-0 than Hawkeyes
thread.title_full: Only 3 teams have clearer path to 12-0 than Hawkeyes

title: Only 3 teams have clearer path to 12-0 than Hawkeyes
text:
Only 3 teams have clearer path to 12-0 than Hawkeyes Only 3 teams have clearer path to 12-0 than Hawkeyes That's if you buy into this totally unscientific formula 
I've covered Iowa football at The Gazette since 1999 Thursday October 22, 2015 
Columnist giving commentary and information about sports in Iowa. Monday October 26, 2015 
Your source for Iowa sports and more. Sunday October 25, 2015 
Covering Iowa State and central Iowa for Eastern Iowa Sunday October 25, 2015 
Kernels baseball, RoughRiders hockey and a lot of things in between. Saturday October 24, 2015 
I cover high school sports and Iowa women's basketball. Monday October 26, 2015 
Sharing community and high school contributed stories Monday October 26, 2015 October 26, 2015 | 12:41 pm 
Let’s get this as clear as the clearest trout stream. 
This is not the least bit scientific. This is totally arbitrary, and my numbers would be slightly different if I did this again in five minutes. It’s purely for fun, for discussion, for a time-waste. 
I’ve looked at the remaining schedules of the 12 unbeaten FBS college football teams and decided who has the best route to a perfect record at the end of their regular-seasons. I assigned what I felt was the likely winning percentage to each of the Dandy Dozen’s remaining games, multiplied them, and came up with what I call the HR (Hlog Rankings) Block. 
Four teams have just four games left instead of five, which obviously helps their chances. Ohio State and Michigan State are 8-0. LSU and Toledo are 7-0, but had their season-openers cancelled because of inclement weather. They would have won those games (at home against McNeese State and Stony Brook, respectively), anyway. 
The following is the HR Block, with the percentage for victory I’ve assigned for each game. I’ll explain my numbers in some places, but not in most. Life is too short. 
1. Clemson .301 
at N.C. State 72 percent 
Florida State 75 
at Syracuse 85 
Wake Forest 98 
at South Carolina 67 … If Clemson is 11-0 going into this game, this should probably be more like 80 percent or more because South Carolina could be playing out the string by then. Maybe it is already. 
2. Ohio State .296 
at Illinois 80 
Michigan State 65 
at Michigan 60 … This may be low. The Ohio State we saw Saturday night at Rutgers looked a lot like the wrecking machine of last January. 
3. Houston .239 
Vanderbilt 79 
Cincinnati 79 … There are some very competitive teams in the American Athletic Conference besides unbeatens Houston, Memphis and Temple, and Cincinnati is among them. 
Memphis 55
